channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13712] Backport HBASE-13199 to branch-1
item.description: HBASE-13199 is practically a requirement for large clusters trying to use Canary; we should port it to branch-1 so that it's usable on clusters with >10k regions.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Simple cherry pick and fix commit issues. Also squashed the two commits into one.

+1

Skimmed the patch, looks fine for branch-1.1 and branch-1.0. Any reason not to bring it all the way back, Elliott Clark, Liu Shaohui? Did I miss something? How about 0.98 as well?
I thought of it more like a new feature so I didn't think we should bring it into 1.1. However for 0.98 since we're treating that a little different it could be good.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12733892/HBASE-13712-branch-1.patch
against branch-1 branch at commit 74e5b26e57ef8d31723ff05ff913bad7f92a7518.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12733892

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 3796 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 3793 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

-1 core zombie tests. There are 5 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestReplicasClient.testSmallScanWithReplicas(TestReplicasClient.java:612)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHTableMultiplexerFlushCache.testOnRegionChange(TestHTableMultiplexerFlushCache.java:106)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestAdmin2.testCreateTableRPCTimeOut(TestAdmin2.java:202)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHCM.testConnectionRideOverClusterRestart(TestHCM.java:1273)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14092//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14092//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14092//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14092//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14092//console

This message is automatically generated.

Nick Dimiduk Elliott Clark
It's my fault.
I think we should push this change to all branches if no objections.
The change is not very large.

The patch uses Connection and other branch-1 constructs pretty liberally so it doesn't apply cleanly.
If someone has time and the desire to backport it to 0.98 I'll commit it.

Looking at the canary code on branch-1. Although the catch clause of RegionTask#call mentions sniffRegion, it doesn't actually call it. There are no callers of sniffRegion in Canary.java. Is this old code that can be deleted?

Here's a backport for 0.98. Essentially a backport of the branch-1 version of the Canary to 0.98 APIs given the necessary changes. I did some simple testing with a small cluster using the Canary in both one shot and daemon modes.
Let me reopen this since there's a patch for 0.98 pending. Can close once there's a disposition for that patch either way.

Wow, what happened with that precommit build. Failures are unrelated.
Thanks Elliott Clark. Pushed to 0.98. Closing this again.
